etymology.description: 电影 (film; ‘electric shadow’) + 明星 (star; celebrity) = movie star
etymology.interpretation: Combines the medium (film) with “star/celebrity” to denote a person famous in cinema. 明星 retains its literal “bright star” metaphor for fame.
etymology.simplification: 电 is the simplified form of 電, reducing strokes for easier writing; 影、明、星 are unchanged.

examples.chinese: 她是著名的电影明星(她是著名的電影明星)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì zhùmíng de diànyǐng míngxīng.
examples.english: She is a famous movie star.

examples.chinese: 这位电影明星(這位電影明星)在红毯上(在紅毯上)引起了(引起了)媒体的关注(媒體的關注)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wèi diànyǐng míngxīng zài hóngtǎn shang yǐnqǐ le méitǐ de guānzhù.
examples.english: This movie star drew the media’s attention on the red carpet.

examples.chinese: 他从电视演员(他從電視演員)转型为(轉型為)电影明星(電影明星)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng diànshì yǎnyuán zhuǎnxíng wéi diànyǐng míngxīng.
examples.english: He transitioned from a TV actor to a movie star.
